name: Hotel la Magnaneraie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is as stated a lovely hotel, classy and a pleasure to stay in. It is outside Avignon which was not an issue but finding it was really difficult. We were assisted by the most helpful of locals who drove and let us follow after much searching. Maybe our navigational skills were at fault but the kindness of these people will be a memory of our lovely holiday. We can recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in mid-September in Room 7 of the old building, which I'd ask for again. It was redone, with a good bathroom, and had a very large balcony overlooking the gardens. Staff was great, especially Chloe and Alexandre at the desk and bellhop spots. Parking is free and easy to use. Decor is very nice and suits the old building well. I would not eat dinner in the restaurant. The Maitre D is a bit snooty and recommended an awful wine. The food was not good. Go down the street to Le Prieure, which is expensive, but super for dinner. Breakfast was good. Avignon cannot be reached on foot, but there are parking garages.
reviews.title: Lovely place, a little out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Best Western La Magnaneraie in early October of 2009 for five nights.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is outstanding and highly recommended. We would stay there again. The staff is very helpful and does speak English. The room (#41) was clean. My wife and I have very high standards in this regard. The decoration style was simple, almost modern. The bathroom was upgraded probably in the last five years and was more than adequate. The chairs in the room were chosen with an eye towards style & not necessarily functionality. As a six foot plus person, these chairs did not work. The pillows were the standard square European flat pillows – you might as well not have any.
reviews.title: Peaceful,Classy and Overlooked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we asked to see what rooms where available. We were offered two choices – a garden level room and one over looking the swimming pool. The lower level garden room was dark. Despite it being day when we saw the room, you would have thought it was night. The room overlooking the pool had an outstanding view and offered plenty of sunlight and privacy. Since it was October and no one was swimming, noise was not an issue.
reviews.title: Fantastic 4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, anyone considering this hotel should know that this hotel is not in Avignon, but in a small town called Villeneuve, about 10km from Avignon proper. Also, this hotel isn't in the town center of Villeneuve, but about a 10 minute walk from it. It's an easy walk, and Villeneuve is quiet and charming but for those who may have a hard time walking, it's not the best location. My husband and I had a car, but found it much easier to walk for dinner---parking downtown was hard in Villeneuve and even harder for Avignon. There is a GREAT garden-style, family-owned restaurant on the way to the Villeneuve town center from the hotel, and Villeneuve itself charming and quaint. La Magnaneraie is a very pretty hotel, but it was expensive considering the location and the fact that the room is well-appointed but not spectacular. The staff was relatively friendly, but quick to push their restaurant rather than offering options elsewhere.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but too expensive for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: This hotel was incredible. The rooms are SPOTLESS. The staff is 1000% helpful. Everything is well thought-out and top notch. The hotel is not actually in Avignon however, but is a short 10 Euro taxi ride away and in a lovely little town called Villeneuve, which btw we enjoyed very much. I can't say enough about this hotel and it's staff. Beautiful garden, trees, eating areas and a very nice swimming pool. And, possibly because it is not exactly in Avignon (which I consider a good thing actually, btw), it is actually reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Best hotel I've stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The staff is professional and courteous and seem intent on good service. The room, however, was dated, plain, and stale. The room was impeccably clean.
reviews.title: 4star hotel, 2.5 star room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed coffee in the garden in the mornings and did not order the buffet.
reviews.title: Beautiful situation - very comfortable and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is tucked away in a residential area and is a 10 min walk to the Villeneuve center and much too far to walk to Avignon. There are several good options for supper in Villeneuve of which Aubergine is new and outstanding and at a fair price. After busy days of sightseeing, we decided to eat supper locally rather than trek to Avignon, park the car, then walk further into the city to find food.
reviews.title: Loved the stay at lovely La Magnaneraie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I selected this hotel based upon Tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. What is not to like? The property is immaculate and the staff is friendly. The garden is beautiful and it is so quiet there that all you can hear is the wind in the trees. But the crowning touch is the restaurant. What could be better than world class cooking only a few steps from your hotel room and eating al fresco in the garden. Our stay here was the most relaxing time of our vacation. If there is a downside, it is the distance of the hotel from Avignon. It's too far to walk. A taxi will cost about 15 euros, each way. Get a card from your taxi so you will able to call for a return pick up or plan on walking to the train station to get a taxi there.
reviews.title: Most Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a driving tour of France we booked the hotel in advance over the internet. It was everything it claimed and even more charming than expected. Has an old world feel as you realize the place has been here a"long time" but has all the freshness and amenities of modern hotel. Far from my vision of a "Best Western". Location was great for day trips to the wine country and other local sights, such as the Pope's Palace. Across the river from Avignon proper it is away for the bustle of the bigger city. Quite serene and peaceful.
reviews.title: Great Location, great hotel

likes.disliked: — Finding it initially. After that , no problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: We spent four nights. Many of our meals were taken in the nearby village of Villeneuve-les-Avignon which was an easy enjoyable walk. The hotel breakfast buffet was too expensive and too elaborate for us. We enjoyed the local shops and the petit de dejeuner of simpler fare. The local restaurants are very good.
reviews.title: This proved to be an excellent choice

likes.liked: — Our lovely room and the tranquility of the place
likes.disliked: — Allowing dogs in the restaurant but, in fairness, other restaurants do likewise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were very attentive and helpful. We felt very comfortable and at home in a short time.
reviews.title: Always ask for a quiet room

likes.disliked: — Being next to the pool and the distance from the Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Initially finding the hotel was a challenge, but once found is easy to come and go to and from. Having printed directions before hand would be a good idea. Parking is free, mostly indoors, and a little jumbled but we had no real issues. Patience becomes acceptable after while..........
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights and wished I have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel.. excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What we loved about this hotel.
reviews.title: Good quiet location..Comfortable but not luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Excellent service from very friendly staffs
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Beautiful garden
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: - dinner in the hotel's garden restaurant (make sure you reserve this)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

aka: Best Western La Magnaneraie Hotel Villeneuve-Les-Avignon
